question: 鼓膜
sourceMnemonic: You can hear something <kanji>beat</kanji> because of a <kanji>membrane</kanji> in your ear called an <vocabulary>eardrum</vocabulary>. Make sure you don't stick your fingers too far in your ear or you could really hurt it.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
